get.description:
<introduction>A PO can request the status and results of a previous Add to Roster, Update on Roster, or Delete from Roster request by submitting the system-generated Batch ID in the following URL.</introduction>

<definition>The Roster Operation Result will take a `batch_id` in its parameters.  This batch id will have been returned to you by a successful `POST`, `PUT` or `DELETE`.  A `GET` call cannot have a request body.</definition>

<responses>
### Update Response

### Add Response

### Delete Response
</responses>

<nextSteps>
### See also:

* [Update Roster](#todo)
* [Delete Roster](#todo)
* [Roster Quick Add](#todo)</nextSteps>

200.description: A successful response will return a provider object.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch id from a previous create, update or delete request.

put.description:
<introduction>A PO can update one or more providers on the roster by submitting a call to the following URL. At least one of the fields with an asterisk (*) is required to process an Update. See 2.1.2 for the immediate system response.</introduction>

<definition>The Update Roster Request takes in an Update Roster object containing a subset of the Roster fields which can be updated.  Keep in mind that this update endpoint takes an array and will reject a request sending a single update object.</definition>

<responses>If your request has been formatted correctly, it will return a batch id and a 200 response code.  If not, the response object will have a "Message" field that will contain the error.  

* 200 Success
* 401 Unauthorized
* 400 Bad Request</responses>

<nextSteps>
### See also:

* [Update Roster](#todo)
* [Delete Roster](#todo)
* [Roster Quick Add](#todo)</nextSteps>

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Product should be either PV or DA for ProView or DirectAssure.

post.description:
<introduction>A PO can add one or more providers to the roster by submitting a call to the following URL. Similar to the Add Roster File process, there are different required and optional fields for the Quick Add verses the Initial Add, and at least one of the fields with an asterisk (*) is required to process an Initial Add.</introduction>

<definition>The body of the Roster Add endpoint can take one or more [provider add](#tocSaddrequest) objects.  If you only have one object, the body must still be passed in as an array.  All body fields are passed in as strings, however many of them have a specific format.  Please see the example object for the format that is required.</definition>

<responses>If your request has been formatted correctly, it will return a batch id and a 200 response code.  If not, the response object will have a "Message" field that will contain the error.  Once you get a 200 response, you will want to save the batch id for use in the [roster operation result](#todo) call.</responses>

<nextSteps>You will receive a [batch id](#tocSaddresponse) which should be passed in to the [roster operation result](#todo) periodically to check if the operation has been processed.  

### See also:

* [Update Roster](#todo)
* [Delete Roster](#todo)
* [Roster Quick Add](#todo)</nextSteps>

200.description: The Add to Roster Web Service immediately returns a Response JSON that includes a system-generated unique Batch ID for the request.

400.description: If there was an error with the request, a 400 status code will be returned with an object that contains the field "Message" with the error.  Please check to make sure your JSON request body is properly formatted.

401.description: If your credentials are incorrect or not authorized to access this endpoint, it will return a 401 status code representing an unauthorized response.  Please double check your credentials and the URL to make sure you're calling the correct environment.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The status endpoint will take the Product of `PV` or `DA`, depending on if you are on ProView or DirectAssure.

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: The ProView roster add endpoint takes in a specific object as its json body.  You can find this object and how to compose it in the [schemas section](#tocSaddrequest).

post.description:
<introduction>A PO can delete one or more providers from the roster by submitting a call to the following URL.</introduction>

<definition>The deroster endpoint will take in an array of objects containing the Organization ID and the CAQH Provider ID.  You will be returned a Batch Id which should be passed into the Roster Result endpoint.</definition>

<responses>If your request has been formatted correctly, it will return a batch id and a 200 response code.  If not, the response object will have a "Message" field that will contain the error.
</responses>

<nextSteps>
### See also:

* [Update Roster](#todo)
* [Delete Roster](#todo)
* [Roster Quick Add](#todo)</nextSteps>

first_name.title: Provider_First_Name
first_name.description: A text field that contains the First Name of the Provider

middle_name.title: Provider_Middle_Name
middle_name.description: A text field that contains the Middle Name or Initial of the Provider

last_name.title: Provider_Last_Name
last_name.description: A text field that contains the Last Name of the Provider.

name_suffix.title: Provider_Name_Suffix
name_suffix.description:
A text field that contains the suffix associated with a Provider’s Name
Note: The value must be from the list of standard suffix values. See Appendix below.

gender.title: Provider_Gender
gender.description: A code that denotes the gender of the Provider.

address1.title: Provider_Address1
address1.description: This field should contain the first line of the address at which the provider can be reached by ProView for correspondence.

address2.title: Provider_Address2
address2.description: A field that contains provider’s correspondence address Line 2

city.title: Provider_Address_City
city.description: A field that denotes the provider’s correspondence address city

state.title: Provider_Address_State
state.description: The two-character ANSI state code that corresponds to the provider’s correspondence address state

zip.title: Provider_Address_Zip
zip.description: A numeric field that denotes a provider’s correspondence address zip code

zip_extn.title: Provider_Address_Zip_Extn
zip_extn.description: An integer field that denotes a provider’s correspondence address zip extension

phone.title: Provider_Phone
phone.description: A field that denotes a provider’s primary phone number.

fax.title: Provider_Fax
fax.description: A field that denotes a provider’s fax number for correspondence.

email.title: Provider_Email
email.description: The primary email address used for correspondence with the provider and for provider outreach.

practice_state.title: Provider_Practice_State
practice_state.description:
The two-character ANSI state code that corresponds to the provider’s primary practice state.
Note: This helps ProView identify state mandated requirements (if any) for the provider.

birthdate.title: Provider_Birthdate
birthdate.description: This field denotes the provider’s date of birth. (Format:  YYYYMMDD)

ssn.title: Provider_SSN
ssn.description: This field denotes the provider’s Social Security Number (Must be 9 digits).

short_ssn.title: Provider_Short_SSN
short_ssn.description:
This field denotes last two Characters of the provider’s SSN. This is required for Illinois providers if all of the following are true:
-	Primary Practice State = ‘IL’
-	Provider_SSN is null 
Application_Type=’2’ for re-credentialing.

dea.title: Provider_DEA*
dea.description:
This field denotes the provider’s Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) Number
(Format must be ‘AA9999999’)

upin.title: Provider_UPIN*
upin.description:
This field denotes the provider’s Unique Physician Identification Number (UPIN)
(Format must be ‘A99999’)

type.title: Provider_Type
type.description:
This field denotes the provider type code based on a list of Standard or Allied provider type codes from ProView.
Note: The value must be from the list of standard ProView Provider Type codes. See Appendix below for a list of valid values.

tax_id.title: Provider_Tax_ID
tax_id.description: This field denotes the Federal Tax ID number of the provider.

npi.title: Provider_NPI*
npi.description: The field denotes the provider’s Type 1 (Individual) NPI number.  (Format: 9 numeric digits followed by one numeric check digit; must be 10 digits)

license_state.title: Provider_License_State
license_state.description:
The two-Character ANSI state code that corresponds to the provider’s license state
This field is required if Provider License Number is populated.

license_number.title: Provider_License_Number
license_number.description: This field denotes the provider’s State License Number. The field is required if Provider License State is populated.
